p: Today, halfway through the 15 years of Agenda 2030, we see children raising their voices and taking action with increasing intensity. The Fridays for Future movement and the Extinction Rebellion engage hundreds of thousands of people across the globe and across all ages from young children to elderly. By non-violent action in intergenerational movements, people are challenging the establishment and demanding climate justice as well as social and cultural fairness. In recent years, indigenous peoples have increasingly contributed to the fight for a more sustainable world. This can be seen as a response to the concerning fact that during the past years, it has become evident that humanity is facing unprecedented challenges.
